Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2008 01:51PM Marianne1954 wrote: Always hated Jan. and even more now.  I was diagnosed in Dec. (nice Xmas present) and had surgery two weeks ago, lumpectomy and 11 lymph nodes removed, three with cancer cells.  I still have the drain and hate it.  Can't make progress with exercises on my own and very depressed.  Going to physio on Monday.  I want my life back.  This was as unexpected as winning the lottery!  January sucks.
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2008 08:37AM Marianne1954 wrote: Hello all; Lost most of my hair yesterday and this morning.  Liberating actually.  I was so sick of hair falling out all over the place.  I'm feeling good and I think I'll pick up another wig this week.  The one I have is blonde and I'm not sure I like it.  My head hurts a bit too, like I read from some of you.  Mostly it's just COLD!  Licorice, my nurses suggested my other half give me my Neulasta needle too, and I said the same thing.  LOL...he'd enjoy that way too much! So I continue on with gel in my remaining hair looking quite "edgy".  Not ready to go out in public without my wig though.  I've never been one to be the center of attention and I'm not starting now.  Hope everyone is doing well today. Take care. Marianne
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 10:29AM Marianne1954 wrote: Hi all; Had my first chemo two weeks ago and today the hair came off.  How liberating is that!!  I thought I'd die when it happened but I'm fine with it.  I have a wig that I can wear out but I'll go natural in the house.  I'm so glad I have others to connect with.  I had no side effects from the chemo and that was another concern I had before I went.  Only 5 left to go and then radiation.  I even gave myself my "neulasta" needle 24 hours after my chemo and I didn't think I could do that either!  Wow, how I'm surprising myself.  It's amazing what you can do when you have no other choice.  About the hair, my grandaughter said to me, "It's a small price to pay for your health, Nana".  Out of the mouths of babes huh?? Best wishes to all of you and I'll check back next week after chemo. Marianne
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking
